analytic.title: Topography and Sanctity in the North Syrian Corridor

biblStruct.note: mé "In this paper, systemic topography, as currently being developed especially in France, will be used to cast light on aspects of the sanctity in Theodoret's "Philotheos". In particular, the notion of a corridor will be used to illumine the diversity in unity of that sanctity, the special role within it of Simeon Stylites, and its possible relationship to an ancient and ongoing Judeo-Christian ascetic tradition." The diversity in unity of North Syrian sanctity. Simeon Stylites. North Syrian sanctity and the Judaeo-Christian ascetic tradition. (p. 113)
